_thread_replies.text: Looks like the data itself is saved but you can see that if an agent or someone looked at the customer's account, cancellation reason is blank

elements.text: Looks like the data itself is saved but you can see that if an agent or someone looked at the customer's account, cancellation reason is blank

_thread_replies.text:
Thank you.
I confirmed that we do save the cancellation reason correctly to the customer's subscription, so it should be an issue with BOB itself.
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CPJDGMMCG/p1759914858759369|I've asked the team that owns BOB for support>. I'll let you know when there's a resolution.

elements.text: Hi
I'm looking for the team that owns BOB, and according to
this doc

, you're the team that owns it.
Our squad, Pet Food, got a report from one of our stakeholders saying that they are unable to see a cancellation reason on BOB for The Pets Table.
This causes issues, for example, when the cancellation reason is a dog's death and we keep sending them marketing emails nudging them to reactivate.
I checked if at the moment of cancellation we are sending the reason correctly and we are. I also checked that the subscription holds that information after deactivation, and I can confirm that it does.
So Im thinking this could be an issue with BOB itself.
Can you support us here please?
Thank you

attachments.fallback:
[October 8th, 2025 2:14 AM] andrea.costa: Hi <!subteam^SNFQ4T3M2> :wave:
I'm looking for the team that owns BOB, and according to <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ConsumerCore/pages/5514363467/Monoliths+Deprecation+Squad?utm_source=fresh_chat|this doc>, you're the team that owns it.
Our squad, Pet Food, got a report from one of our stakeholders saying that they are unable to see a cancellation reason on BOB for The Pets Table.
This causes issues, for example, when the cancellation reason is a dog's death and we keep sending them marketing emails nudging them to reactivate.
I checked if at the moment of cancellation we are sending the reason correctly and we are. I also checked that the subscription holds that information after deactivation, and I can confirm that it does.
So Im thinking this could be an issue with BOB itself.
Can you support us here please?
Thank you
attachments.text:
Hi <!subteam^SNFQ4T3M2> :wave:
I'm looking for the team that owns BOB, and according to <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ConsumerCore/pages/5514363467/Monoliths+Deprecation+Squad?utm_source=fresh_chat|this doc>, you're the team that owns it.
Our squad, Pet Food, got a report from one of our stakeholders saying that they are unable to see a cancellation reason on BOB for The Pets Table.
This causes issues, for example, when the cancellation reason is a dog's death and we keep sending them marketing emails nudging them to reactivate.
I checked if at the moment of cancellation we are sending the reason correctly and we are. I also checked that the subscription holds that information after deactivation, and I can confirm that it does.
So Im thinking this could be an issue with BOB itself.
Can you support us here please?
Thank you

elements.text:
Thank you.
I confirmed that we do save the cancellation reason correctly to the customer's subscription, so it should be an issue with BOB itself.
I've asked the team that owns BOB for support
. I'll let you know when there's a resolution.

<@U047SAC2PPV>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Deprecating subscribable-addon-bff`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hey team, you might now that we launched a new feature on NV-CRM to send emails for subscribable addons for Factor.

This feature also works for TPT and it's been enabled on staging as well.

I need someone from TPT to do a QA on staging and (if you have access to salesforce) live.

Here is the QA doc: <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/x/woFSUAE>`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U047SAC2PPV>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Deprecating subscribable-addon-bff`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hey team, you might now that we launched a new feature on NV-CRM to send emails for subscribable addons for Factor.

This feature also works for TPT and it's been enabled on staging as well.

I need someone from TPT to do a QA on staging and (if you have access to salesforce) live.

Here is the QA doc: <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/x/woFSUAE>`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To QA the subscribable addons feature for TPT on staging and live:

1. Access the QA document: <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/x/woFSUAE|QA Doc>

2. Test on staging:
   - Use the provided Vercel link: <https://web-staging-pzj5mtjpo.preview.hellofresh.io|Staging Preview>
   - Login with test account: `<mailto:efe@de.com|efe@de.com>` (password: 123456)
   - Navigate to the dashboard
   - Scroll to "Selected add-ons for this box"
   - Try adding multiple addons (one from each category, mix one-off and weekly)

3. Test on live (if you have Salesforce access)

4. Check for any errors when saving addons to the account

5. Report any issues or confirm successful testing to the team

*Note*: There have been some flaky behaviors reported on staging. If you encounter issues, please report them to the <!subteam^S049E8T2LMA> team.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1750863272603809?thread_ts=1750863272.603809&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C06EH1LF4HW/p1719451747810459?thread_ts=1719451747.810459&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] addons_subscription event: 0 records >
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C049H9UE22X/p1728401519077879?thread_ts=1728401519.077879&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] 500 when updating subscribable addon quantites on staging> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U047SAC2PPV>? Unified Search :mag: button

_thread_replies.text:
So subscribing to an addon always applies from the current week, and it doesnâ€™t matter which week you pass in your request 

The only thing that matters is the effective date, which should be next running and modifiable week

elements.text: So subscribing to an addon always applies from the current week, and it
doesnâ€™t

matter which week you pass in your request 

The only thing that matters is the effective date, which should be next running and modifiable week

_thread_replies.text: yeah, it says effective date the 15th, but I skipped them that week

elements.text: yeah, it says effective date the 15th, but I skipped them that week

_thread_replies.text: Yep, this is the correct behaviour. Essentially youâ€™re subscribing to an addon, but removing it from the current week as a oneOff, which doesnâ€™t affect your subscription

elements.text: Yep, this is the correct behaviour
Essentially
youâ€™re
subscribing to an addon, but removing it from the current week as a oneOff, which
doesnâ€™t
affect your subscription

_thread_replies.text:
<@U8F7ZDAPM> thank you for catching this!

Do you have any suggestions on how I could proceed: fetching current subscriptions details in the runtime (might increase overall update time) or prefetching them?

elements.text:
thank you for catching this!

Do you have any suggestions on how I could proceed: fetching current subscriptions details in the runtime (might increase overall update time) or prefetching them?

_thread_replies.text:
I think we're going to have to fetch them, I would suggest calling `useCustomerSubscriptions`  in `EditDeliveryAddressRoot` and rendering `<PageSpinner />` until the data is fetched. The good thing is that 9/10 times this data should already have been fetched and persisted from earlier in the user experience so I dont think it will affect loading time for most users.

Once we have the data we can <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/01f9b9fdda73efe6b306dfaeac05d700a6f0fed9/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/EditDeliveryAddress/hooks/multi-pet/useHandleSaveAddress.ts#L96|change this map> to loop over the actual subscriptions instead of just an array of subscription IDs, and the subscription object should give you access to the address ID

_thread_replies.text:
Sorry <@U07JV68BQ79> there's 1 more case that i've missed, which is if the address change results in an invalid delivery option (since available delivery options are partially dictated by postcode). You'll notice that the subscription patch you're removing also updates the delivery option (i.e. `deliveryTime`). If we don't do this then a user can end up on an invalid delivery option for their zipcode when updating address

So if the feature flag is on we should still patch the subscription with the delivery option along with the address patch.

elements.text: Sorry

there's 1 more case that i've missed, which is if the address change results in an invalid delivery option (since available delivery options are partially dictated by postcode). You'll notice that the subscription patch you're removing also updates the delivery option (i.e.
deliveryTime

). If we don't do this then a user can end up on an invalid delivery option for their zipcode when updating address

So if the feature flag is on we should still patch the subscription with the delivery option along with the address patch.

Backend is going to validate them <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/EditDeliveryAddress/hooks/useProductParams.js#L25|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitel[â€¦]gs/src/components/EditDeliveryAddress/hooks/useProductParams.js>

_thread_replies.text:
to clarify, i've tested this case on your PR and the issue does happen. If you want to reproduce you can use my account again:
<mailto:aw6@test.com|aw6@test.com>
123123

1. Make sure the account has the postcode 14001 and Dry plan (this combination unlocks Tuesday delivery option)
2. Go to Delivery window and update the delivery Day to Tuesday
3. Go to address and update it to 10004 (Tuesday not available)
4. On Settings you'll see that the user is still on Tuesday
5. Go to Delivery Window and you'll see the UI breaks (Because Tuesday is not a valid delivery option)

Go to Delivery window and update the delivery Day to Tuesday
Go to address and update it to 10004 (Tuesday not available)

Go to Delivery Window and you'll see the UI breaks (Because Tuesday is not a valid delivery option)

_thread_replies.text: Hey <@UFC7CRXMZ> - no we never implemented a weight limit in the quiz. The way we're currently handling it is through displaying the message that's visible on your screenshot. elements.text: Hey

_thread_replies.text:
Thanks <@U03UMPD2NNS> It would be helpful to see their pet profile data.

Took a look at the data you shared and for >2050 cals:
â€¢ There's a long tail of very high cals which we likely won't be able to serve
â€¢ But assuming we manage to serve customers up to 2550, we would capture 80% of those above and could improve CVR by 0.42% (these are also high AOV and quite profitable customers. It's part of our 2026 plan to capture more of these larger dogs)
On the cals below 90, if we manage to even just stretch this by 2 cals and include the 88 cal dogs, then we would capture half of the <90 cals bucket. Realise we can't go much lower but <@U0177S413PC> if there's a way to even just enable 88 cals, that would be helpful for CVR

elements.text: Thanks

It would be helpful to see their pet profile data.

Took a look at the data you shared and for >2050 cals:
There's a long tail of very high cals which we likely won't be able to serve

But assuming we manage to serve customers up to 2550, we would capture 80% of those above and could improve CVR by 0.42% (these are also high AOV and quite profitable customers. It's part of our 2026 plan to capture more of these larger dogs)
On the cals below 90, if we manage to even just stretch this by 2 cals and include the 88 cal dogs, then we would capture half of the <90 cals bucket. Realise we can't go much lower but
if there's a way to even just enable 88 cals, that would be helpful for CVR

_thread_replies.text: thanks Maria, I added a distribution table of the additional calories we would need to add. only adding 2050 would capture 31% of that 0.5%. We would need to add 4 more calories to capture 80% (rest is a long tail up to 6000 calories). That would be at least 36 more calories SKUs so we need to weigh that against our other initiatives to complicate our SKUs

And here's the <https://docs.google.com/document/d/11MqwTk9jVJeDRPAoc_VucKtVaMeShHiYiNMU4obRbZs/edit?tab=t.0|scope doc>. Anisha & I have aligned on how we provide over 80% of these customers with a product.

*Solutions with owners:*
1. Allow 88 cals for Air Dried and Fresh Plans to get our 100 cal SKU (<mailto:maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com|Maria Chelminska>)
2. Improve the copy on the page where a customer is told there isnâ€™t a matching SKU (<mailto:maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com|Maria Chelminska>)
3. Add a 60 cal SKU for the Air Dried plan only i.e. â…› of a cup (<mailto:anisha.chandra@hellofresh.com|Anisha Chandra> to lead with support from <mailto:lgui@hellofresh.com|Laurent Guillemain> <mailto:maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com|Maria Chelminska>)
4. Add 2250 cal SKU for all plans (<mailto:anisha.chandra@hellofresh.com|Anisha Chandra> to lead with support from <mailto:lgui@hellofresh.com|Laurent Guillemain> <mailto:maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com|Maria Chelminska>)

to summarize, the goal here:
â€¢ <87 - no plan (update, as of now it is 89)
â€¢ Between 88-149 - offer only 100% plan for dry and fresh 
â€¢ Between 150-225 - offer 100% and 75% plan for dry and fresh
â€¢ 226+ - offer mixed plan + 50% 75% and 100% percentages for dry and fresh
